context: As part of a security incident on 2024-07-04, the Mimikatz credential theft tool was detected on a device. Mimikatz is known for harvesting plaintext passwords, password hashes, smartcard PINs, and Kerberos tickets. This detection shows an attempt to use `mimikatz.exe` for credential theft. The following command lines were observed: `4748__2024-06-27t14:33:38.0249949z__mimikatz.exe lsadump::dcsync /domain:vnevado.alpineskihouse.co /user:xfbzkp exit` and `5176__2024-06-27t14:33:32.4282796z__mimikatz.exe privilege::debug kerberos::ptt c:\m365dattack\admin-tickets exit`. The aim of this attack could be to harvest credentials to log into this or other devices within the network.
question: During this incident, there was also suspicious access to the LSASS service. Can you identify the name of the file used for this access?
solution_steps: The Mimikatz hacktool was detected executing with Process ID `6880` at `2024-06-27t14:32:37.7041174z`, using the command line `mimikatz.exe privilege::debug sekurlsa::pth /user:fk8mq /ntlm:96def1a633fc6790124d5f8fe21cc72b /domain:vnevado.alpineskihouse.co /run:"powershell.exe dir \vnevado-win10bideshare"`.
There was suspicious access to the LSASS service involving the file `get-krbticket.ps1`.
